instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Auto Starting Every Time
threads.message: Any idea where to start with this? It's a fully functional 2014 MacBook Pro 13". Passed ASD. But it always auto starts when plugged in. Battery is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Auto Starting Every Time
threads.message: PRAM reset? Did you shut down from OSX?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Auto Starting Every Time
threads.message: Yes and yes. It's a computer we thought was done and was going through testing fine so it's been shut down and restarted multiple times from within OS X. Did PRAM and SMC reset. No change.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Auto Starting Every Time
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Auto Starting Every Time
threads.message:
No Title

Ultrasonic-only fix. Some type of spill. Looks like some corrosion around the top right of the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Auto Starting Every Time
threads.message: Reflow/reball SMC and replace clock chip.
